content.question: Steel is an alloy containing <math alttext="F e" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms and <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms. Which of the following diagrams best represents the particle-level structure of steel?

choices.label: The figure presents a particle diagram consisting of 12 large unshaded circles, which represent C atoms and 6 small shaded circles, which represent F e atoms. The large C atoms are arranged in a 3 by 4 array. The small F e atoms are located throughout this lattice, at every intersection of four large C atoms.

The figure presents a particle diagram consisting of 12 large unshaded circles, which represent F e atoms and 6 small shaded circles, which represent C atoms. The large F e atoms are arranged in a 3 by 4 array. The small C atoms are located throughout this lattice, at every intersection of four large F e atoms.

The figure presents a particle diagram consisting of 6 unshaded circles, which represent C atoms and 6 shaded circles, which represent F e atoms. The circles are all the same size and are in a 3 by 4 array, alternating between F e atoms and C atoms. Rows 1 and 3 begin with a F e atom, and row 2 begins with a C atom.

The figure presents a particle diagram consisting of 6 large unshaded circles andÂ  3 small unshaded circles, which represent C atoms, and 6 large shaded circles and 3 small shaded circles, which represent F e atoms. The large C and F e atoms are in a 3 by 4 array, alternating between F e atoms and C atoms. Rows 1 and 3 begin with a F e atom, and row 2 begins with C atom. The small C and F e atoms are located throughout this lattice, at every intersection of four large atoms. The small atoms alternate between C and F e atoms, such that the first row of intersections begins with a C atom, and the second row of intersections begins with a Fe atom.

content.answer: The figure presents a particle diagram consisting of 12 large unshaded circles, which represent F e atoms and 6 small shaded circles, which represent C atoms. The large F e atoms are arranged in a 3 by 4 array. The small C atoms are located throughout this lattice, at every intersection of four large F e atoms.

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
